description:
If a instance is paused by other tools (i.e. virt-manager), the vm_state in database doesn't update(The vm_state remained active, so we can not unpause the instance from horizon),
but power_state does.
title: pause vm_state is not synchronized with power_state

comments.content:
If a instance is paused by other tools (i.e. virt-manager), the vm_state in database doesn't update(The vm_state remained active, so we can not unpause the instance from horizon),
but power_state does.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kylin7-sg

comments.content: If OpenStack is managing VMs, I don't know that it should be expected that it has to deal with state changes made to the VMs by other applications.  If you're using OpenStack to manage the VMs, I think you should only be using OpenStack to manage the VMs.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content: Russel, this may be true, but what about situations where the vm crashes or goes into another state due to some failure? I chatted with Yun Mao about this, and it sounds like we can do some synchronization that would line up the states if they get out of sync, which should also recover from this error as a side-effect.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda
